He listens, and relents. WINFRIED (CONTвЂ™D) OK... fine. Yes, OK. See you later. He hands the phone back to Anca. WINFRIED (CONTвЂ™D) (in English) I shall follow you. Anca looks at him in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winfried sits with Anca on the office building's modern r a few tourist brochures and a city map, which sheвЂ™s mar

dialogues.text: And here is the Radisson, also one of the five-star hotels in town. The restaurant is excellent. And there is also a nice cigar lounge for business meetings... or drinks in the evening.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Iam only the father. Just holidays. (in German) I donвЂ™t really look the part. AncaвЂ™s cellphone rings. She listens with intense concen around at the terrace. A few people in suits are sitting

dialogues.speaker: ANCA
dialogues.text: She asks whether you would like to accompany her to a reception of the American embassy this evening?

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Was that she?

dialogues.speaker: ANCA
dialogues.text: (in German) Yes, sheвЂ™s still in the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: (mixing German and English) OK. When she will... For a moment, neither of them knows what to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) And how is my daughter as a boss? (in English) As your chief? Anca isnвЂ™t sure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: ANCA
dialogues.text: Yes, sheвЂ™s very honest, and she gives me a lot of feedback... about my performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering in English) вЂњPerformance?вЂќ This means... this describes your job?

dialogues.speaker: ANCA
dialogues.text: (in German) Performance means my work in general... in meetings, with the team, dealing with clients.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: And what's most important when dealing with clients?

dialogues.speaker: ANCA
dialogues.text: That no concept makes sense if the client doesnвЂ™t want it. ItвЂ™s an art to tell the client what he actually wants.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sure my daughterвЂ™s good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winfried sits on the back seat of a spacious car being dr a hotel. The driver, BOGDAN, is speaking to someone via a

dialogues.speaker: BOGDAN
dialogues.text: (into earpiece) Weare here. (to Winfried) She is coming.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Thank you. He pats Bogdan on the shoulder. Outside, Ines hurries out into the back seat of the car, next to Winfried. She kiss

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, sure, you have to work.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've really invaded you here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: How long were you actually sitting there?

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Three hours. I wasnвЂ™t even sure youвЂ™d recognized me.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Yes, I did, but that was the entire Romanian board of Dacoil. How was everything with Anca?

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: They were all terribly nice to me. Winfried nods towards Bogdan.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: The driver, too. Ines nods and smiles tensely.

dialogues.speaker: INES CONRADI
dialogues.text: So listen, concerning this event tonight: ItвЂ™s a business reception given by the American Embassy. There'll be speeches, appetizers, small talk and thatвЂ™s it. Ines looks at her cellphone and rejects an incoming call.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Great. Can I go like this? HeвЂ™s wearing dark-colored jeans, a shirt and walking sh the problem.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Yeah, thatвЂ™s OK.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s a great football match today, too. If Bogdan drops me somewhere... I'll have a beer.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: But IвЂ™ve already arranged this now. Winfried quickly takes his false teeth from his jacket p mouth.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: I just wasnвЂ™t sure whether itвЂ™s really OK for you and the ambassador...

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Are you interested now or not? He takes the teeth out again. She looks at the entrance. going inside.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Of course. I think itвЂ™s amazing that you're taking me with you. IвЂ™ve never been inside an embassy before.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: That's a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Just one last thing: After the reception, if thereвЂ™s achance to have a drink with the CEO, Henneberg, our client, I have to go alone, OK? IвЂ™m fighting right now to get our contract extended.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. No concept makes sense without the client.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: You can say you're my father, but maybe that you're tired because you've done so much sightseeing, or something.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: But I also donвЂ™t mind if you tell them IвЂ™m your Grandma. Ines and Winfried get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ines and Winfried enter the lobby of a large communist-er around with interest. Ines walks purposefully to the tabl procures two wristbands. Guests hurry up a staircase. Ine speeches have already begun. She glances quickly at her p Winfried walk up a grand, communist-era staircase towards speech is already being held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ines and Winfried slip into the ballroom, which is full o the colors of the U.S. flag. People are clapping, and Ine what was just being said.

dialogues.speaker: U.S. AMBASSADOR
dialogues.text: But this is still not the answer to this simple and serious question: Why Romania? And as an ambassador in this country one must have a good answer to that. And I have one: Romania offers significant opportunities to American businesses with products, services, or technologies that either meet growing private demand or contribute to the countryвЂ™s development priorities. Ines looks around discreetly and, once again, claps along else. Most of the guests are businesspeople of various na says a few words in Romanian and then brings his speech t U.S. AMBASSADOR (CONTвЂ™D) Ladies and gentlemen, the buffet is open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speech is over, and the guests move towards the buffe eyes a group of businesspeople. Winfried looks at a man h

dialogues.text: Hey, that guy looks like Tiriac. Ines looks half-heartedly towards the man in question.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe. Could you grab us something from the buffet?

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Ines watches as Winfried walks to the buffet. SheвЂ™s gla edges towards the businesspeople (VERMILLARD, DASCALU). S until an opportunity presents itself, then homes in on He around 60, and shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Our third time today, finally... Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: Yes, good evening.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: That was a fascinating speech...

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: Yes, we're not where we want to be yet, but Romania has really shown great economic strength in overcoming the crisis. Henneberg glances at the other people lining up to speak

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: I looked at our business case again. And IвЂ™m optimistic that we'll be able to make a well- founded statement on Monday. Without really having listened, Henneberg turns and gestu looking woman (NATALJA) aged around 40.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: Natalja, here is your specialist. IвЂ™m sure Ms. Conradi can help you.

dialogues.speaker: NATALJA
dialogues.text: So nice to meet you. Ines doesnвЂ™t know what this is about, but nonetheless s drawn in so quickly.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: She needs to do some shopping tomorrow. (to Natalja) Ms. Conradi works in Bucharest for... how long?

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s been almost a year now. You keep me busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess you can ask her any shopping question. The two women shake hands. Henneberg turns away to a new, conversational partner - MR. MYERS, an American.

dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry for this. | am sure you are busy, but...

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: No, itвЂ™s OK.

dialogues.speaker: NATALJA
dialogues.text: We have this wedding in Moscow this weekend. And I still need some presents. Ines is still looking at Henneberg, who has now been acco

dialogues.speaker: NATALJA
dialogues.text: The mall is OK. I have only two hours tomorrow. Ialso need childrenвЂ™s stuff, cosmetics... In the background, Winfried reappears carrying two plates them down ona table next to Henneberg.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Why donвЂ™t you give me your number, and I'll scout for the best place and text you? The two women begin to swap their numbers. The others say Henneberg, the executive. HeвЂ™s used to having people li turns to Winfried, assuming that heвЂ™s next.

dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Good evening. IвЂ™m just the father. Winfried nods towards Ines.

dialogues.text: Isee. The two women are still talking.

dialogues.text: (to Natalja) I have been to Moscow only once, but I really loved it. I was so impressed by the Bolshoi Theater.

dialogues.speaker: NATALJA
dialogues.text: Oh yes, it is a remarkable place. Ines keeps an eye on her father while she continues to li

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Yes. A totally spontaneous decision. IвЂ™ve never been to Romania before.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: Then you just had a good introduction from the Ambassador. Their conversation comes to an amicable halt.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m actually here to negotiate with her. SheвЂ™s hardly at home anymore, so I hired someone to be a substitute daughter. A really nice young woman. Now itвЂ™s just the question of who pays her. Henneberg canвЂ™t help but laugh. Ines is straining to he whilst also trying to politely focus on Natalja.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s a modern solution. And is the other daughter better than her?

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: The cakes are better, and she cuts my toenails. Again, the executive canвЂ™t help but laugh. Winfried ges

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: OK. Criticism accepted. (referring to the food) I didnвЂ™t know what you like. Awoman (TATJANA) interrupts Ines from behind. SheвЂ™s pas keep up with a group of Chinese businesspeople.

dialogues.speaker: TATJANA
dialogues.text: Da Vinci, 9 p.m. (quietly) I donвЂ™t know what to talk about.

dialogues.text: Just talk about food. That always works.

dialogues.speaker: TATJANA
dialogues.text: Like вЂњWhatвЂ™s your favorite Wan-Tan?вЂќ I know nothing about Chinese food.

dialogues.text: (in English) Want to join us for a drink? He catches himself and switches to German.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: Winfried. Henneberg also looks at Ines, but the question seems to b Winfried. Natalja joins him, and she seems to be keen for

dialogues.speaker: INES

dialogues.text: A classy restaurant where foreign businesspeople meet and class flashes its cash. The group sits on a terrace near group of people surrounds Henneberg: Natalja, Winfried an further businesspeople, M. Vermillard, Mr. Myers and Dasc managers or business partners of Dacoil. Winfried has a l of him. The others are more refined, with glasses of wine

dialogues.text: Bring your wife next time... and spend a weekend. The sea is very close and there are good French private schools. Romania is a lot better than its reputation. You can have a good life here. HeвЂ™s addressing the French businessman, Vermillard, who Bucharest.

dialogues.text: I saw some houses today. I am already convinced. Natalja is sitting next to Ines.

dialogues.speaker: NATALJA

dialogues.text: (in German) I totally understand. Ines picks up a piece of octopus carpaccio and tries to g refuses.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: You know me. Ines focuses on the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: There is still a lot of potential. I just told Van Rompuy, letting Romania in was one of the rare EU decisions that was actually good. You just have to change the corporate culture.

dialogues.text: (to Henneberg and Dascalu) Tell mea bit about the young Romanian manager generation? Dascalu is about to respond when Henneberg turns to Ines.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: She is the specialist. She has all the insights. For a moment, Ines is surprised that heвЂ™s deferring to question.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: So, when I started here I was really surprised. Almost everyone did a Master's degree abroad, speaks several languages. They are all very dedicated. I would even say most of them have a very international way of thinking. Which is great. InesвЂ™ English is so perfect that she could be mistaken which she speaks is self-confident and to-the-point. Dasc interrupts her.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: I was just trying to say that knowledge is international. | totally agree with that, too.

dialogues.speaker: DASCALU

dialogues.text: (to Ines) What exactly are you doing in Dacoil?

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: lama consultant at Morrisons. We are working for Dacoil evaluating if it will pay off to outsource some services. Dascalu frowns briefly, and Henneberg notices this.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: (in German) Interesting how you describe your job. His tone is cutting.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: (in German) IвЂ™m sorry, please say it in your own words.

dialogues.speaker: HENNEBERG
dialogues.text: (in English, to the group) She is evaluating a way to improve our maintenance service. We see outsourcing as the last option of many.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, this is what I tried to say. For a moment, the group falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her father had a great business idea for Romania. He hired another girl at home to be his daughter. Because this one is never there and he needs somebody to cut his toenails. Everyone laughs slightly. Ines, too, bravely laughs along watch. Winfried puts the false teeth in his mouth and qui

Henneberg laughs indulgently, but itвЂ™s clear that heвЂ™ total madman. WINFRIED (CONTвЂ™D) (in German) No, weвЂ™re incredibly proud of her. What she does here... and stuff. Ines smiles, trying to rise above the situation. Henneber bring him the check. Henneberg stands up and shakes hands Now that Henneberg is gone, the rest of the group immedia follows Henneberg. The Belgian and the Frenchman talk for waiter brings Winfried another beer.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: I somehow had to make it clear to him that it was a joke. What exactly is вЂњoutsourcingвЂќ again?

dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s when you transfer work to another company. He wants to transfer the maintenance of the oil installations to another company.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: So what was wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Ijust shouldnвЂ™t have let it slip out... He wants us to prove that itвЂ™s precisely the right thing to do, but he doesnвЂ™t want it to be his idea - so he can pin the responsibility on us if he needs to. She doesnвЂ™t want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: And... what are you responsible for?

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Dad, these processes mean hundreds of employees being transferred and later laid off. These kind of decisions are unpopular, so he needs to be able to blame someone else. Then you can read in the paper again that some consulting firm has ruined something.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s incredible the kinds of decisions you're involved in making.

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: Again: I donвЂ™t make any decisions. I just do the calculations. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not criticizing you. I just want to understand it. What these projects are about...

dialogues.speaker: INES
dialogues.text: How long are you planning to stay?

dialogues.speaker: WINFRIED
dialogues.text: I took a month off. Ines freezes for a second.  WINFRIED (CONTвЂ™D) That was real fear. And a minimal solution in just one pilot asset that changes practically nothing.

dialogues.text: For option one we assume that it will take one year for the implementation. The implementation cost, internal and external, will be around five to six million euros. The advantage of a full outsourcing is the contractor rates. We will have a strong competition resulting in lower rates. ThatвЂ™s why we will end with a ten-per-cent cost reduction in the first year.
